byline.contributor: John M. Broder and Ian Urbina contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Texas Gov Rick Perry, as part of his campaign for the Republican presidential nomination, releases jobs and energy proposal that promises new drilling across the country, curtailing of environmental regulations and 'dismantling' of the Environmental Protection Agency; critics say plan would make little headway towards freeing nation from reliance on foreign energy and creating jobs.
snippet: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas laid out his jobs and energy proposal Friday, vowing new drilling, fewer environmental regulations and a dismantled Environmental Protection Agency.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas laid out his jobs and energy proposal Friday, vowing new drilling, fewer environmental regulations and a dismantled Environmental Protection Agency.

headline.main: Perry Promises Increased Drilling and Decreased Regulation
headline.print_headline: Perry Presents a Jobs and Energy Proposal With an Oil and Gas Industry Sound
headline.seo: Perry Promises Increased Drilling and Decreased Regulation
